oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Rosa Parks on boycott and arrest
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Rosa Parks on Montgomery Bus Boycott and her arrest.

Rosa Parks, famous for helping organize the Montgomery Bus Boycotts in 1955-1956, attended a workshop led by Septima Clark at Highlander Folk School four months before refusing to give up her bus seat in Montgomery on December 1,1955. Photographs of Parks's time at Highlander were used in the propaganda campaign to shut the school down.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Parks, Rosa (1913-2005); Montgomery Bus Boycott, Montgomery, Ala., 1955-1956; Civic leaders; Civil rights movements
